entry.title: Air Arabia may file arbitration claim against Armenia: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Air Arabia may file arbitration claim against Armenia: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç The Emirati low-cost carrier Air Arabia is planning to file an arbitration case against the Armenian government over the failed Fly Arna joint venture, news.am reported. üìç A lack of judicial independence continues to deter foreign investors from Armenia, the U.S. State Department found in its latest Investment Climate Statement for the country. üìç Entrepreneur Adam Kablanian talks tech and wine in Armenia: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0gY3jhsZih

entry.title: Macron defends France‚Äôs arms sales to Armenia

media:group.media:title: Macron defends France‚Äôs arms sales to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
üìç French President Emmanuel Macron defended his country‚Äôs sales of weapons to Armenia, saying Yerevan has the right to protect itself against future aggression. üìç Armenia opened a criminal probe in connection with a military plane crash that took place during a training exercise north of Yerevan. It left two service members dead.

entry.title: Starlink‚Äôs potential impact on Armenia's security and economy

media:group.media:title: Starlink‚Äôs potential impact on Armenia's security and economy
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet Podcast, scientist and investor Dr. Armen Kherlopyan discusses the potential impact of Starlink on Armenia's security and economy. He explores the timeline for Armenia receiving Starlink, a revolutionary internet technology developed by Elon Musk that allows connectivity anywhere on earth using satellites, analyzing whether the projected 2025 implementation is timely or belated. Dr. Kherlopyan also delves into the challenges and opportunities presented by operating Starlink in Armenia, offering unique insights from his perspective as both a tech expert and a venture capitalist.

entry.title: US to dispatch first resident adviser to Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry

media:group.media:title: US to dispatch first resident adviser to Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry
media:group.media:description:
üìç An Armenian government spokesperson blamed Baku for rejecting an offer by Yerevan to set up a meeting between the two countries‚Äô leaders at a major European summit. üìç Russia‚Äôs ambassador to Yerevan said his country is waiting for Armenia to take ‚Äúfurther steps‚Äù before it can establish a consulate in the strategically important Syunik region. üìç The European Union‚Äôs foreign policy body confirmed the appointment of Czech diplomat Magdalena Grono as the bloc‚Äôs next special representative for the South Caucasus. üìç The United States will dispatch its first resident adviser to Armenia‚Äôs Defense Ministry.

media:group.media:title: Diaspora myths meet Armenian truths
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet podcast, Eric Hacopian and Patrick Elliott tackle prevalent myths about living in Armenia, offering a reality check for the diaspora. The discussion delves into various aspects of life in the country, including the economy, the security situation, and cultural nuances.
